intro: Mapouria betamponensis, commonly known as the Madagascar mapouria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and a tubular corolla. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
